alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:53PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Natrona County through 330 PM MDT... At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northwest of Alcova, which is also 27 miles west of Casper, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Natrona County, including the following locations... Bessemer Bend and Casper Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for central Wyoming.
